channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @raggedmouths @MAdryaelTong How is Paul more Jewish than Jesus?

@trekonomics I suspect he tried to mansplain to his daughter one times too many and she wasn’t having any more of it. It might have worked if they were still married and Mom came to Dad’s defense.
@trekonomics Absent a united parental front, a father’s only superpower is unrepentant kvelling.
@ThatRabbiCohen יום הולדת שמח! https://t.co/08GWoAm9m4
@froomkin Has the Post announced new op ed hires?

The lines between being too stupid to consider other people, too wounded psychologically to consider other people, and too evil to consider other people really don’t make much a difference at the end of the day.
@typolad As someone who is not an audiophile, I’ve been happy with cheap headphones in the $25 range. Happy to send you a link.

@bruces I’ve been waiting for Love Me Do to be remade by Dick Nixon and the Kennedy Brothers since reading the earliest articles on digitize audiovisual synthesis in the Whole Earth Review 30+ years ago.
@trekonomics What’s the current rate? Happy to chip in for your GoFundMe to make you an aristocrat!
@rmneiss Go with both and you only need 400 words on each prong of your think piece.

@MAdryaelTong I see them as akin to Elphantine texts — they reflect the history of Jews and Jewish writing, they shed light into how Jewishness and Judaism was understood at the time, but they’re not a direct contribution to the body of Jewish thought or Judaism.
@rmneiss Their insecurity at not being Christian enough for today’s GOP after the rejection of Eric Cantor?
@jh_swanson The interesting question is whether it provides more or less funding for Yiddish culture than does the Swedish government, which considers Yiddish a minority language.

I’m literally a museum piece! https://t.co/zjIECs36iw
That’s an exaggeration. I started in the 80s, with a mix of analog and digital. Selectrics and luggables, WordPerfect and Roladex.

“Merril points out that her social expectations were shaped not by 1950s conformity but by 1930s radicalism, thus her rejection of the default belief that the girls’ role is to reassure the boys who run everything.” https://t.co/u5estSpCTG
“Also, she was a significant figure in the Futurians and it may be that dealing with certain male Futurians did not incline her to see men as natural leaders.”
Shas lawmaker says Doron Almog 'unworthy of his new position' after footage surfaces in which he says his daughter read from the Torah 30 years ago. https://t.co/t8UGAAqLig
@Weirdascanbe1 @DBashIdeas @jorosenfeld @shuaros Just want to save the next person a Google search. Never heard of the book before.
@Weirdascanbe1 @DBashIdeas @jorosenfeld @shuaros The Empty Wagon: Zionism's journey from identity crisis to identity theft https://t.co/rJQemymirX
@GenizaLab Why don’t you display liturgical poetry? And why would the good doctor be practicing his signature on the margins?
@fmc_dylan Makes me glad to have forwarded your Part II to my audiophile friend.

@datadivajf Comics are totally delightful.
@datadivajf Even though their portrayal of NJ yeshiva high school dismissal hours are not fully accurate. https://t.co/Nfxzl2ZsIK
@ProjectTzimtzum @BenYehudaPress Happy birthday!

Nothing says “We are the world. This is our home planet!” like “New York/New Jersey a Host City” https://t.co/BBx3ULZGWF
And I thought American baseball’s “World Series” was geographically illiterate.
@DandiaAsad Nothing says “We are the world. This is our home planet!” like “New York/New Jersey a Host City”
@AriCohn @BlueBoxDave In the Alito Court, everything settled is new again.
